alert.note: Alert for Chaves; Lincoln (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 11 at 9:02AM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON MDT TODAY... * WHAT...Arroyo and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of central and southeast New Mexico, including the following counties, in central New Mexico, Lincoln. In southeast New Mexico, Chaves. * WHEN...Until noon MDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 856 AM MDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms drifting west to southwest around the Capitan Mountains and Archuleta Creek. This will cause arroyo and small stream flooding. Up to 1 inch of rain has fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Arabela. - State Roads 246 and 368, Forest Roads 130, 616, 5657, and County Roads B7, B20, and B26. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
